definition: abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: The school is financed by American and South Korean evangelical Christians.
sentences.chinese: 学校的资金由美国和南朝鲜福音派教会提供。

sentences.english: Korea still keeps people locked up for refusing to perform military service.
sentences.chinese: 甚至南朝鲜把拒绝服兵役的人关起来。

sentences.english: The South Korean businessmen will take great risk for the slave labor.
sentences.chinese: 南朝鲜的商人是为了这些奴隶劳工才冒这么大的险。

sentences.english: These refugees had to be fed and housed in the South. A few thousand crossed over from South to North.
sentences.chinese: 于此同时也有几千人从南朝鲜逃到北朝鲜。

sentences.english: The ROKs apparently have no stomach for fighting Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 南朝鲜人很显然并没有与中国人作战的勇气。

sentences.english: In the South, there is open talk of “liberating” the North.
sentences.chinese: 而南朝鲜的“解放北方”的叫嚣，也是甚嚣尘上。

sentences.english: It makes me sick too the way you gooks pronounce foreign languages.
sentences.chinese: 更让我受不了的是你们这些南朝鲜佬外语的发音。

sentences.english: See you at the next Asian Games in Pusan, South Korea 2002.
sentences.chinese: 在釜山在下一个亚洲运动会看见你，南朝鲜2002。

sentences.english: Notable capital flow of migrants has taken place between South Korea and Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 显著的移民资本流动已经在南朝鲜与延边之间发生。

definition: Syngman Rhee (1875-1965), US trained Korean politician and dictator, president of Republic of Korea 1948-1960
Hanseong, former name of Seoul (capital of South Korea), replaced in 2005 with 首爾|首尔[Shou3 er3]
the Chinese People's Volunteer Army deployed by China to aid North Korea in 1950
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 ren2 min2 zhi4 yuan4 jun1

definition: Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
